public class MainFormController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The Controller for Main-Form fxml.

  • Constructor Details

    • MainFormController

      public MainFormController()

  • Method Details

    • partSearchHandler

      public void partSearchHandler()
      This method searches for parts in the mainFormPartsTable. If a part is found it add that part to the search results. If no part is found a message pops up stating no results found. If no part is found the search field is reset. Search Results are added into the mainFormPartsTable.

    • productSearchHandler

      public void productSearchHandler()
      This method searches for products in the mainFormProductsTable. If a product is found it adds it to the search results. If no product is found a message pops up stating no results found. If no product is found the search field is reset. Search results are added into the mainFormProductsTable.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This is the initialize method. This runs first and sets the part and product tables up.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - url.
      resourceBundle - rb.

    • mainFormAddPartClick

      public void mainFormAddPartClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is method called when the Add(part) button is clicked. This takes the user to the Add Part Form.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Add button clicked
      Throws:
      IOException - exception.

    • mainFormModifyPartClick

      public void mainFormModifyPartClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the method called when the Modify(part) button is clicked. This takes the user to the Modify Part Form. An error message is generated if no part is selected. This method uses the partToBeModified variable.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Modify button clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - exception.

    • selectedPartToModify

      public static Part selectedPartToModify()
      This method is used to send a selected part to the Modify Part Form. When called it returns the partToBeModified variable.
      Returns:
      partToBeModified

    • selectedProductToModify

      public static Product selectedProductToModify()
      This method is used to send a selected product to the Modify Product Form. When called it returns the productToBeModified variable.
      Returns:
      productToBeModified

    • mainFormDeletePartClick

      public void mainFormDeletePartClick()
      This method deletes a part. If not part is selected an error message appears. If a part is selected a confirmation appears.

    • mainFormAddProductClick

      public void mainFormAddProductClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method takes the user to the Add Product Form.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Add button clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - exception.

    • mainFormModifyProductClick

      public void mainFormModifyProductClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method sends the user to the Modify Product Form. An error message appears if no product is selected. This method uses the productToBeModified variable.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Modify button clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - exception.

    • mainFormDeleteProductClick

      public void mainFormDeleteProductClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method deletes a product. An error appears if no product is selected. An error appears if a product has an associated part. If a part is selected and has no associated parts a confirmation box appears.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Delete button clicked.

    • mainFormExitClick

      public void mainFormExitClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method exits the program when EXIT is clicked. A confirmation box appears before exiting.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Exit button clicked.

    • partSearchKeyPressed

      public void partSearchKeyPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      This method triggers the partSearchHandler when a key is pressed in the part search text field. This method resets the table to include all parts if the parts search field is empty.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - Key pressed in part Search Field.

    • productSearchKeyPressed

      public void productSearchKeyPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      This method triggers the productSearchHandler when a key is pressing in the product search text field RunTime Error Section Here. This method resets the table to include all products if the products search field is empty. ~~~~~RUNTIME ERROR~~~~~~ One of the errors I encountered while making this application happened within the search feature. This method previously would only call the search handler method. This properly searched for products but had a small bug. The search handler would reset the search field to be empty but the table wouldn't repopulate. To solve this issue I added an IF statement to this method that would repopulate the table if the search field was empty.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - Key pressed in product search field.
